meanings.definition: To demonstrate in opposition to a demonstration.
meanings.sent1: During the protest, we decided to counterdemonstrate peacefully.
meanings.sent2: The group planned to counterdemonstrate against the rally in the park.
meanings.sent3: When they saw the march, they quickly organized to counterdemonstrate.
meanings.sent4: In response to the protest, they chose to counterdemonstrate with their own signs.
meanings.sent5: The students felt strongly about their cause and wanted to counterdemonstrate effectively.

meanings.definition: To show or prove something by demonstrating against it.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to counterdemonstrate her support for the new policy.
meanings.sent2: The activists aimed to counterdemonstrate the flaws in the proposed law.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would counterdemonstrate his dislike for broccoli.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were a way to counterdemonstrate her commitment to the environment.
meanings.sent5: The experiment was designed to counterdemonstrate the effectiveness of the new product.
